content:
In this equation, the number of muffins (m) is the dependent variable because it is determined by the number of classmates (c). The number of classmates is the independent variable because it is not determined by the number of muffins.

In general, the independent variable is the variable that is being manipulated or changed in an experiment or equation, while the dependent variable is the variable that is being measured or observed. In this case, Victoria is deciding how many muffins to bake based on the number of classmates she has, so the number of classmates is the independent variable and the number of muffins is the dependent variable.
